verses.kjv: And the ark of the LORD was in the country of the Philistines seven months.
verses.ct: The ark of the LORD remained in Philistine territory for 7 months.

verses.kjv: And the Philistines called for the priests and the diviners, saying, What shall we do to the ark of the LORD? tell us wherewith we shall send it to his place.
verses.ct: The Philistines summoned their priests and diviners and asked, "What should we do with the ark of the LORD? Tell us how we should send it back to where it belongs."

verses.kjv: And they said, If ye send away the ark of the God of Israel, send it not empty; but in any wise return him a trespass offering: then ye shall be healed, and it shall be known to you why his hand is not removed from you.
verses.ct: They replied, "If you're going to send the ark of the God of Israel back, don't send it without an offering. You must include a guilt offering for him. Then you'll be healed, and you'll understand why his punishment hasn't been lifted from you."

verses.kjv: Then said they, What shall be the trespass offering which we shall return to him? They answered, Five golden emerods, and five golden mice, according to the number of the lords of the Philistines: for one plague was on you all, and on your lords.
verses.ct: The Philistines asked, "What kind of guilt offering should we send back to him?" They answered, "5 gold tumors and 5 gold rats — one for each of the Philistine rulers — because the same plague has struck all of you and your rulers alike."

verses.kjv: Wherefore ye shall make images of your emerods, and images of your mice that mar the land; and ye shall give glory unto the God of Israel: peradventure he will lighten his hand from off you, and from off your gods, and from off your land.
verses.ct: "So make models of your tumors and models of the rats that are destroying your land, and give honor to the God of Israel. Maybe he will ease his punishment on you, your gods, and your land."

verses.kjv: Wherefore then do ye harden your hearts, as the Egyptians and Pharaoh hardened their hearts? when he had wrought wonderfully among them, did they not let the people go, and they departed?
verses.ct: "Why would you be stubborn the way the Egyptians and Pharaoh were stubborn? After God dealt with them powerfully, didn't they finally let the people go, and the Israelites left?"

verses.kjv: Now therefore make a new cart, and take two milch kine, on which there hath come no yoke, and tie the kine to the cart, and bring their calves home from them:
verses.ct: "Now then, build a brand-new cart and get 2 cows that are nursing their young and have never worn a yoke. Hitch the cows to the cart, but take their calves away and pen them up back home."

verses.kjv: And take the ark of the LORD, and lay it upon the cart; and put the jewels of gold, which ye return him for a trespass offering, in a coffer by the side thereof; and send it away, that it may go.
verses.ct: "Then place the ark of the LORD on the cart. Put the gold objects you're sending as a guilt offering in a chest beside it, and send it on its way."

verses.kjv: And see, if it goeth up by the way of his own coast to Bethshemesh, then he hath done us this great evil: but if not, then we shall know that it is not his hand that smote us: it was a chance that happened to us.
verses.ct: "Then watch — if it heads up the road toward Beth Shemesh, into Israelite territory, then the LORD is the one who brought this terrible disaster on us. But if it doesn't, then we'll know it wasn't his power that struck us — it was just bad luck."

verses.kjv: And the men did so; and took two milch kine, and tied them to the cart, and shut up their calves at home:
verses.ct: So the men did exactly that. They took 2 nursing cows, hitched them to the cart, and penned up their calves at home.

verses.kjv: And they laid the ark of the LORD upon the cart, and the coffer with the mice of gold and the images of their emerods.
verses.ct: They placed the ark of the LORD on the cart, along with the chest containing the gold rats and the models of their tumors.

verses.kjv: And the kine took the straight way to the way of Bethshemesh, and went along the highway, lowing as they went, and turned not aside to the right hand or to the left; and the lords of the Philistines went after them unto the border of Bethshemesh.
verses.ct: The cows went straight down the road toward Beth Shemesh, staying on the main path and mooing as they walked. They never wandered off to the right or the left. The Philistine rulers followed behind them all the way to the border of Beth Shemesh.

verses.kjv: And they of Bethshemesh were reaping their wheat harvest in the valley: and they lifted up their eyes, and saw the ark, and rejoiced to see it.
verses.ct: The people of Beth Shemesh were harvesting wheat in the valley. When they looked up and saw the ark, they were overjoyed.

verses.kjv: And the cart came into the field of Joshua, a Bethshemite, and stood there, where there was a great stone: and they clave the wood of the cart, and offered the kine a burnt offering unto the LORD.
verses.ct: The cart rolled into the field of Joshua of Beth Shemesh and stopped near a large rock. The people chopped up the wood from the cart and sacrificed the cows as a burnt offering to the LORD.

verses.kjv: And the Levites took down the ark of the LORD, and the coffer that was with it, wherein the jewels of gold were, and put them on the great stone: and the men of Bethshemesh offered burnt offerings and sacrificed sacrifices the same day unto the LORD.
verses.ct: The Levites lifted down the ark of the LORD and the chest that held the gold objects, and they placed them on the large rock. That same day the people of Beth Shemesh presented burnt offerings and other sacrifices to the LORD.

verses.kjv: And when the five lords of the Philistines had seen it, they returned to Ekron the same day.
verses.ct: After the 5 Philistine rulers watched all of this, they returned to Ekron that same day.

verses.kjv: And these are the golden emerods which the Philistines returned for a trespass offering unto the LORD; for Ashdod one, for Gaza one, for Askelon one, for Gath one, for Ekron one;
verses.ct: These are the gold tumors the Philistines sent as a guilt offering to the LORD: 1 for Ashdod, 1 for Gaza, 1 for Ashkelon, 1 for Gath, and 1 for Ekron.

verses.kjv: And the golden mice, according to the number of all the cities of the Philistines belonging to the five lords, both of fenced cities, and of country villages, even unto the great stone of Abel, whereon they set down the ark of the LORD: which stone remaineth unto this day in the field of Joshua, the Bethshemite.
verses.ct: The gold rats corresponded to the total number of Philistine towns belonging to the 5 rulers — both the fortified cities and the unwalled villages. The large rock in the field of Joshua of Beth Shemesh, where they set down the ark of the LORD, remains there to this day as a witness.

verses.kjv: And he smote the men of Bethshemesh, because they had looked into the ark of the LORD, even he smote of the people fifty thousand and threescore and ten men: and the people lamented, because the LORD had smitten many of the people with a great slaughter.
verses.ct: But God struck down some of the men of Beth Shemesh because they looked inside the ark of the LORD. He killed 70 men among the people, and the people mourned deeply because the LORD had struck them with such a devastating blow.

verses.kjv: And the men of Bethshemesh said, Who is able to stand before this holy LORD God? and to whom shall he go up from us?
verses.ct: The people of Beth Shemesh said, "Who can stand in the presence of the LORD, this holy God? Where should the ark go from here?"

verses.kjv: And they sent messengers to the inhabitants of Kirjathjearim, saying, The Philistines have brought again the ark of the LORD; come ye down, and fetch it up to you.
verses.ct: So they sent messengers to the people of Kiriath Jearim with this message: "The Philistines have returned the ark of the LORD. Come down and take it back with you."
